org.phantomapi.gui

Interface Window

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    ListViewWindow, PhantomDialog, PhantomSelectDialog, PhantomWindow, TabbedWindow

    public interface Window
    A Window which holds element objects.
    Author:
    cyberpwn

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Window addElement(Element element)
      Add an element to the window
      Window build()
      Build all the elements into an actual inventory object and prepare it for opening
      Window close()
      Close the window (called when the player closes the window aswell)

      Does the window contain the given element?

      • open

        Window open()
        Open the window (builds and opens inventory)
        Returns:
        this

        Close the window (called when the player closes the window aswell)
        Returns:
        this

      • onClose

        void onClose(Window w,
             org.bukkit.entity.Player p)
        The viewer closed the window
        Parameters:
        w - the window
        p - the player

        Window build()
        Build all the elements into an actual inventory object and prepare it for opening
        Returns:
        this

      • contains

        boolean contains(Slot slot)
        Is the given slot an element?
        Parameters:
        slot - the slot
        Returns:

      • contains

        boolean contains(Element element)
        Does the window contain the given element?
        Parameters:
        element - the element
        Returns:
        true if it does

      • getElement

        Element getElement(Slot slot)
        Get the element at the desired slot
        Parameters:
        slot - the slot
        Returns:
        the element. Null if no element.

      • addElement

        Window addElement(Element element)
        Add an element to the window
        Parameters:
        element - an element instance. The element must be unique (not the same id) and cannot have a slot already being used in this window. Else, nothing will happen
        Returns:
        this

      • removeElement

        Window removeElement(Element element)
        Remove an element from the window
        Parameters:
        element - the element
        Returns:
        this

      • getBackground

        Element getBackground()
        Get the background element
        Returns:
        the element

      • setBackground

        Window setBackground(Element background)
        Set the background element for this window. Non-element slots will by default take up "air" elements. You can change it here
        Parameters:
        background - the element
        Returns:
        this

      • getViewport

        Integer getViewport()
        Get the height viewport (6 is typical)
        Returns:
        the height

      • setViewport

        Window setViewport(Integer viewport)
        Set the height of this window
        Parameters:
        viewport - must be between 1 and 6
        Returns:

      • setInventory

        Window setInventory(org.bukkit.inventory.Inventory inventory)
        Set the inventory
        Parameters:
        inventory - the inventory
        Returns:
        this

      • onClick

        boolean onClick(Element element,
                org.bukkit.entity.Player p)
        Fired when an element is clicked
        Parameters:
        element - the clicked element
        p - the clicker
        Returns:
        if true is returned, the element event will be called. If false, the element event wont be registered, effectivley cancelling it

      • isOpen

        boolean isOpen()
        Is the inventory open?
        Returns:
        true if it is
